comment: Hua was possibly one of my best professors during my Freshman year at SPSU. He was very helpful and explained new topics thoroughly and clearly. I'm not sure what others are mentioning about him just using the book, cause in my class he expressed deep distaste for the book. And no, he doesn't grade homework. This is established very early on.

Had Dr. Xu for 3 classes this semester, Stats, Discrete, and Calc2. I made A's in all 3. Dr. Xu teaches with a great mix of knowledge and humor. Also grades some of his test with a curve. It depends on how well the rest of the class is doing. He also allows you to use a formula sheet on test and quizes. He is always willing to help outside of class

Professor Xua is awesome!  Very energetic, extremely knowledgeable, and actually made Differential Equations quite enjoyable.  He is very challenging and the final was extremely difficult.  Grades on a curve and is very fair in his grading.  Examples are very thorough and if you follow through with recommended homework problems, you will be fine.

This is a good Professor. He is always energetic in teaching somestimes he goes over the class time though. I only passed 2 test out of 4 still made a C. Make sure you practice the practice test because they are VERY similiar to the tests. He also helps his students
Very, Clean and helpful professor and is straight forward in his teaching methods. He only gives tests and quizs as grades so better do well in them.

Professor Xu knows what he is doing and has a very good understanding of the subject, and will help greatly, only thing no homework is required and tests are the only grade so, one can fall behind, if you don't do work, though he covers everything in class really well. He however has an accent that you will understand in about a class or two.

Amazing teacher. Very knowledgeable succinct. He does go pretty fast, but I didn't find it tough to keep up with him. He's very good at skipping unnecessary stuff and teaching just what you need to know. Class has 4 tests, with lowest dropped. Each test has a sample test that he reviews before and will sometimes use problems from it for the test.

Easy to understand if you're capable of understanding accents.  Takes 4 exam grades and drops your worst.  Has a practice test available a week beforehand and he reviews the questions on it the lecture before class. Overall a good teacher for a difficult subject (Cal2) that is energetic, knowledgeable, and unfairly bagged on by rate my proff users.

Really smart guy. He is good at answering good questions, but if you ask a stupid question or you're way off, he may not get a grasp on where you are. He goes fast so you're gonna have to pay close attention. If you put forth the effort while in lecture you'll be fine. Also don't worry, his english is great. Took him for stats and then calc 2.
his class is easy , that is if you took calc  in highschool then it is a breeze if you have never taken calc pick a new teacher or u will fail

Calc I: He is a horrible teacher (I'm not just saying this). He does teach REALLY fast, writes fast, has horrible hand writing and makes a lot of mistakes on the board. He doesn't check HW and barely goes over it. His tests are are hard and failures are high in his class. I had to drop his class for a better professor!

Extremely intelligent, talks very fast, tough to follow.  He spends way to much time showing you things you do NOT need to know, or showing you how people sometimes do things incorrectly.  Grades on a curve or most people would fail his class.

Does not seem to want to help students very much. He focuses more on examples from the first parts of each section we cover. Travels at a very fast pace. I generally have no idea what is going on half the time. Please, unless you are good at teaching yourself, do not take this teacher.
Teaches only examples from the first of each section. Does not allow time for questions from the HW. Does grade on a curve. Very poor teacher.
